===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=n|rs=辰00}}

# the [[dragon]] as the fifth sign in the Chinese [[zodiac]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[じん]] (jin)|kanon=[[しん]] (shin)
|kun=[[たつ]] (tatsu)
|nanori=[[とき]] (toki), [[のぶ]] (nobu), [[のぶる]] (noburu)
}}

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds containing {{lang|ja|辰}}}}
* {{l|ja|辰韓|tr=[[しんかん]], ''[[shinkan]]''}}: the [[w:Jinhan confederacy|Jinhan confederacy]]: a twelve-member [[confederation]], located on the southeast of the Korean peninsula during the [[w:Proto–Three Kingdoms of Korea|proto-Three Kingdoms period]], later absorbed into the growing [[w:Silla|Silla]] kingdom
* {{l|ja|辰刻|tr=[[しんこく]], ''[[shinkoku]]''}}: the [[hour]] of the dragon: 7:00 AM to 9:00 AM
* {{l|ja|辰刻法|tr=[[しんこくほう]], ''[[shinkokuhō]]''}}: a [[timekeeping]] method used during the Edo period, using six hours for the day and six for the night
* {{l|ja|辰沙|tr=[[しんしゃ]], ''[[shinsha]]''}}, {{l|ja|辰砂|tr=[[しんしゃ]], ''[[shinsha]]''; [[しんさ]], ''[[shinsa]]''}}: [[cinnabar]], [[mercury sulfide]]: a common [[ore]] of [[mercury]]
* {{l|ja|辰砂油|tr=[[しんしゃゆ]], ''[[shinshayu]]''}}: cinnabar oil, [[vermilion]] oil: cinnabar mixed with oil, used to treat [[dermatitis]]
* {{l|ja|辰宿|tr=[[しんしゅく]], ''[[shinshuku]]''}}: a [[constellation]]
* {{l|ja|辰祭り|tr=[[たつまつり]], ''[[tatsu matsuri]]''}}: "dragon [[festival]]": a [[ceremony]] in Edo-period Japan, held at the houses of the [[wealthy]] in the hour of the dragon on the first day of the dragon after [[New Years]]
* {{l|ja|辰松|tr=[[たつまつ]], ''[[Tatsumatsu]]''}}: the name of a [[family]] of traditional Japanese [[puppeteer]]s
* {{l|ja|辰松風|tr=[[たつまつふう]], ''[[Tatsumatsu fū]]''}}: a men's [[hairstyle]] popular in the middle of the Edo period, popularized by a noted [[puppeteer]] of the ''Takamatsu'' family
* {{l|ja|辰星|tr=[[しんせい]], ''[[Shinsei]]''; [[たちみぼし]], ''[[Tachimiboshi]]''}}: alternate name for the planet [[Mercury]]; alternate name for the star [[Antares]]
* {{l|ja|辰年|tr=[[たつどし]], ''[[tatsudoshi]]''}}: the year of the dragon under the Chinese [[zodiac]]
* {{l|ja|辰巳|tr=[[たつみ]], ''[[tatsumi]]''}}: between the dragon and the snake: around 9:00 AM on the clock, or [[southeast]] on the [[compass]]
* {{l|ja|辰巳下り}}, {{l|ja|辰巳下|tr=[[たつみさがり]], ''[[tatsumi sagari]]''}}: [[gentle]] and [[refined]] of [[speech]] and [[manner]]
* {{l|ja|辰巳上り}}, {{l|ja|辰巳上|tr=[[たつみあがり]], ''[[tatsumi agari]]''}}: [[shrill]] and [[loud]] of [[speech]], [[crude]] and [[course]] of [[manner]]; a [[woman]] from the Fukugawa [[red-light district]] in Edo
* {{l|ja|辰巳言葉|tr=[[たつみことば]], ''[[tatsumi kotoba]]''}}: a [[slang]] or [[argot]] used by the prostitutes and geisha of the Fukugawa [[red-light district]] in Edo
* {{l|ja|辰巳調子|tr=[[たつみちょうし]], ''[[tatsumi chōshi]]''}}: [[shrill]] and [[loud]] of [[speech]], [[crude]] and [[course]] of [[manner]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 1===
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=しん}} {{m|zh|辰}}.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|しん}}

# the [[dragon]] as the fifth sign in the Chinese [[zodiac]]

===Etymology 2===
By extension from the verb {{m|ja|たつ|tr=tatsu||to [[get up]], to [[take off]]}}, from the notion of a dragon flying.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|たつ}}

# the [[dragon]] as the fifth sign in the Chinese [[zodiac]]
# by extension from the zodiac:
## the name of the year or day corresponding to the fifth in a cycle of twelve
## roughly [[east-southeast]], specifically 30° south of [[due]] [[east]] (i.e. a [[bearing]] of 120°)
## the [[hour]] of the dragon, specifically 7:00 AM to 9:00 AM; sometimes treated as 8:00 AM to 10:00 AM instead
## alternate name for {{m|ja|三月|tr=sangatsu||the month of March}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|辰の市|たつ の いち}}: in the [[Yamato]] kingdom of ancient Japan, markets held every day of the dragon
* {{ja-r|辰の一点|たつ の いってん}}: the first 30 [[minute]]s of the [[hour]] of the dragon
* {{ja-r|辰の刻|たつ の こく}}: the [[hour]] of the dragon
* {{ja-r|辰の時|たつ の とき}}: the [[hour]] of the dragon
{{der-bottom}}

=====Idioms=====
* {{ja-r|辰に巻いて巳にこぼす|たつ に まいて み に こぼす}}: sunny one day, rainy the next
